Diagnosis
	1. Locally advanced squamous cell carcinoma of right parietal scalp with regional lymph node involvement

	Date of diagnosis
	February 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Feb 2024 Wide local excision of scalp lesion with skin grafting and selective neck dissection

	Radiotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Chemotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Post-surgical, awaiting adjuvant therapy

	Current issues
	Delayed wound healing at graft site

	Summary of consultation
	This 67-year-old gentleman's case was discussed at today's Head and Neck MDT. The pathology from his recent surgery shows a 4.2cm moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma with 8mm depth of invasion. There is extensive lymphovascular invasion and perineural invasion. The deep margin was close at 1mm. Two of seven lymph nodes from the selective neck dissection show extracapsular spread. PD-L1 testing shows CPS of 30.

The surgical site is showing delayed healing with a small area of graft failure (2x3cm) requiring ongoing dressing care. Otherwise, he is recovering well with good shoulder movement and no facial nerve weakness. His performance status remains 1.

After extensive discussion, the MDT recommends adjuvant chemoradiotherapy with concurrent cisplatin, given the high-risk features (extracapsular spread, close margins, lymphovascular invasion). The radiotherapy plan will encompass the primary site and ipsilateral neck to a dose of 66Gy in 33 fractions with a simultaneous integrated boost to areas of extracapsular spread.

	Further investigations
	Baseline audiometry and EDTA clearance required before cisplatin

	Medication prescribed
	None today

	Follow up
	Urgent referral to clinical oncology for treatment planning
Surgical follow-up in 2 weeks for wound review

	Required GP actions
	Please continue wound care support via district nursing
Monitor renal function prior to chemotherapy

	Summary of information given to the patient
	MDT outcome will be discussed at next clinic visit
